recipe.name: Parmesan Shortbread Biscuits
recipe.description: These buttery biscuits have the texture of shortbread with the kick of parmesan cheese flavour. The biscuits are buttery and have a "soft crumble" when you bite into them. IMPORTANT: Please ensure you measure the ingredients by weight. Cup sizes measure between countries and so for accuracy reasons, I have written the recipe by weight rather than cups because this recipe requires accurate measurement of ingredients to achieve the desired result.
recipeIngredient: 1 tbsp rosemary leaves (, roughly chopped (or 2 1/2 tsp dried rosemary))

recipeInstructions.name: Two Ways To Make The Dough

itemListElement.text: Process the butter, flour and parmesan in a food processor until a wet crumbly dough; OR
itemListElement.name: Process the butter, flour and parmesan in a food processor until a wet crumbly dough; OR

itemListElement.text: Alternative method: Place the flour and butter into a bowl and use your fingers to rub the butter into the flour until a crumble dough forms. Then add the parmesan cheese and use your fingers to rub it into the mixture.
itemListElement.name: Alternative method: Place the flour and butter into a bowl and use your fingers to rub the butter into the flour until a crumble dough forms. Then add the parmesan cheese and use your fingers to rub it into the mixture.

itemListElement.text: If you are making rosemary biscuits, add the rosemary at the same time as the parmesan cheese.
itemListElement.name: If you are making rosemary biscuits, add the rosemary at the same time as the parmesan cheese.

itemListElement.text: Lightly flour a surface and turn the dough out onto it. Knead to bring together, then shape into two logs with a diameter of around 3 cm / 1.2" and about 15cm/6" in length.
itemListElement.name: Lightly flour a surface and turn the dough out onto it. Knead to bring together, then shape into two logs with a diameter of around 3 cm / 1.2" and about 15cm/6" in length.

itemListElement.text: Wrap with cling wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour or until firm. (Note 2)
itemListElement.name: Wrap with cling wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour or until firm. (Note 2)

itemListElement.text: Preheat oven to 180¬∞C/350F. Line 1 large baking tray or 2 ordinary baking trays with baking paper (parchment paper).
itemListElement.name: Preheat oven to 180¬∞C/350F. Line 1 large baking tray or 2 ordinary baking trays with baking paper (parchment paper).

itemListElement.text: Remove the log from the fridge and use a sharp knife to cut the log into 7mm/ 1/3" thick rounds.
itemListElement.name: Remove the log from the fridge and use a sharp knife to cut the log into 7mm/ 1/3" thick rounds.

itemListElement.text: Place the biscuits onto the baking tray at least 2cm / 1" apart.
itemListElement.name: Place the biscuits onto the baking tray at least 2cm / 1" apart.

itemListElement.text: Bake biscuits for 12 minutes or until light golden.
itemListElement.name: Bake biscuits for 12 minutes or until light golden.

itemListElement.text: Stand on trays for 5 minutes then transfer to a wire rack to cool.
itemListElement.name: Stand on trays for 5 minutes then transfer to a wire rack to cool.

review.reviewBody:
So easy & so good.
The hardest part, apart from eating them all,  was getting the dough logs the right size
These are THE most delicious savoury biscuits, & they ARE  so easy to make.11/10üòÄ

I've tried other versions of this recipe before, and this is the best version of this recipe - weighing the ingredients guarantees that they are equal measure.  
I added 1 tsp of cayenne for a bit of heat. Very nice, if you like a bit of heat.
I also tried adding toasted sesame seeds, 'everything but the bagel' seasoning, and cracked black pepper as toppers because I don't love rosemary.  All were good additions - my favorite was 'everything but the bagel.'.

These little biscuits are very rich & tasty. Prep time is quick & simple and with ingredients I always have on hand. A keeper recipe, they will be a lovely addition to any snack plate or charcuterie board.

These came out PERFECT! They look and taste like they took much more work than they did! This recipe is definitely a keeper. I‚Äôm going to make these instead of having cheese and crackers the next time I have guests over. 10/10 recommend. üëåüèª
The flavour of cheesey goodness with a crumbly texture - what more could you want!
This is such an easy yet spectacular recipe. How to impress your friends in one simple recipe
Omg so easy so delicious. Made these to gift for Christmas thankfully took advice to make double batch!
SO easy (especially if you have a food processor) and SO delicious! I‚Äôll be making this as gifts and to take to Christmas celebrations this year - thanks Nagi!
